summary: 15 X-Men Who Match Up With Your Favorite Game of Thrones Characters
title: 15 X-Men Who Match Up With Your Favorite Game of Thrones Characters
body:
15 X-Men Who Match Up With Your Favorite Game of Thrones Characters

With the final season of Game of Thrones upon us, we thought it necessary to take a closer look at the franchise, and heck, why not compare them to another that is also looking down a barrel; the X-Men. The characters in both franchises share a surprising amount of similarities, but that’s not so crazy. They are both built on solid concepts and storylines that span years of carefully crafted…

View On WordPress

summary: The Single Dad's Guide To The Game Of Thrones: Final Season Predictions
title: The Single Dad's Guide To The Game Of Thrones: Final Season Predictions
body:
The Single Dad’s Guide To The Game Of Thrones: Final Season Predictions

It’s D-Day.  Or should I say, D-Day for Game of Thrones, the series expected to have over a billion people watch later this evening?  And with that, we bring a conclusion to our Game of Thrones predictionsabout Westeros and what will happen in it.  Because by the time this evening comes around, several of my predictions will be proved wrong (if not all), many could be proved right, and we may all…

blog.title: Spring comes to Winterfell
blog.description: My personal collection of GoT/ ASoIaF

summary: Hey! What do you think of Tyrion dying in the end? With Jaime hopefully getting his redemption and on the right side, will...
question: Hey! What do you think of Tyrion dying in the end? With Jaime hopefully getting his redemption and on the right side, will Tyrion switch sides, once he learns of Jon's claim? D's said she'd burn anyone who betrayed her(varys for now but I'm sure it extends to anyone in her circle) I thought for a while now when Tyrion can't control D's impulsive decisions, he'll hopefully leave her but I think also he might justify D till the very end... I think it's very unlikely all the Lannisters survive.
answer:
Hi, thank you very much for your message. In my opinion, Tyrion’s arc will be one of the most interesting arcs in season 8. 

His trilemma

He will find himself struggle between various missions (or priorities): his duty to Dany, Jaime, Cersei (and the child she bears, since I believe he promised her to protect her child), or the realm. At some point, he will have to choose what should be his highest priority. 

As Peter Dinklage has said:  “He’s trying to figure out who he really is in this storm of negotiations.” (Peter Dinklage on Tyrion in S8, EW), Tyrion must first identify who he is: the Hand to Queen Daenerys, a Lannister, or a man who serves the realm. Once he figures out who he should be, the choice will be easier. 

Since Jaime would definitely choose to do the right thing (fighting for the living), that would be a decisive factor to sway Tyrion to the Starks’ side, if Dany abandons the fight for the living prematurely. It’s independent of the news about Jon’s parentage. I guess once Jaime arrives in WF, he will have a private chat with Tyrion, in which Tyrion knows that Cersei cheats. So, to protect his siblings,  he will cover such news from Dany, knowing that she is not tolerant and would harshly punish both Cersei and Jaime (and even Tyrion himself) if she knows. He might even secretly make a deal with the Starks in case Dany turns on them. 

However, sooner or later, Dany will realize that the Lannister duo hide the news from her. Coupling with Jon’s parentage (I don’t know how they would reveal the news to the public yet, but it will be absolutely dramatic), Dany will be on fire. My bet is she’s setting WF on fire before she leaves. 

At this point, I think Tyrion would firmly choose his brother over Dany. He will stay with Jaime in WF. Now he knows that Dany will go South to punish Cersei, his next mission is secure an alliance with the Starks for Cersei to save her arse. His role has always been a negotiator.

What does true love mean?

To add more complication to the mix, I believe, at some point, Tyrion will fall in love with Sansa. And his affection for her could be a decisive factor, that moves him for better (or worse?). We will have to wait to see how it turns out. 

About his fate, in my opinion, Tyrion’s fate was sealed the moment he cursed the whole King’s Landing and killed his father. He will see with his own eyes how his curse becomes real, under the hand of his once beloved Queen, the one he helped bring to Westeros. That would be a very very tragic moment for Tyrion. He would not able to forgive himself for wishing such horrible fate for people of this city, and now it is a reality, a reality he helped to forge. In some sense, he has become the monster everyone thinks he is. 

Would Tyrion redeem himself? I think, he would. All his life, Tyrion has been seeking love, acceptance and recognition, from his family and from other people. But he never knows what true love is, except the brotherly love with Jaime. All he’s ever known was politics, money matters and whoring. His relationship with Shae was lust and possession. With Dany, it was a mixture of adoration, fear, the thirst for revenge on Cersei (now he realizes how wrong he was to wish so), and the hope to have his place in building a new world (he will also realize he chooses the wrong person to put this hope on). To make his arc full circle, he will in the end understand what love truly means. Why I believe true love will matter for Tyrion? Because of this converstion from season 2 with Cersei. It was moment after Myrcella’s departure for Dorne (due to a betrothal Tyrion arranged for her) and before the riot in KL (when Sansa was nearly raped and Tyrion was panicked that they lost her.)

One day I pray you love someone. I pray that you love her so much. When you close your eyes, you’ll see her face, you’ll know what it feels, you’ll know what is like to love someone, to truly love someone. Before I take her from you. (Cersei to Tyrion, 2x06)

Interestingly, the camera panned to Sansa after Tyrion left the scene.

Throughout season 2, 3 and the beginning of season 4, they’ve already planted the seed of romance between Tyrion and Sansa (’though one-sided). So what would mean for Tyrion if he realizes that he truly loves someone? Sadly for him, that person might not love him back. What would he do? 

To love is to sacrifce

As Peter Dinklage has said about the Tyrion’s arc, “It ends beautifully for my character whether it be tragic or not.”, so a tragic end is almost guaranteed. But it will be a beautiful end, we will lose lots of tears over the departure of his character. And I think, all of us could be happy for him, if in the last days of his life, Tyrion would understand what it means to truly love someone. Maybe he would never get anything in return, but at least such love brings him a little joy. That’s the sweet part of love. The bitter part? To love someone truly sometimes means that you have to sacrifice yourself so that the one you love would be safe. And I cannot think of anyone else but…

his brother, Jaime…

and this kind-hearted, beautiful princess.

These two people are the sunshine in Tyrion’s world. 

Tyrion’s legacy

Surprisingly, the only person in GoT who might have some glimsp of how to build a better world, up to this point, is Tyrion. He suggested a new way of succession to Dany (to ensure the vision of a new world will sustainably last and would be further built upon generations after generations), not through bloodline, but through election, which can be considered a break-through in the medieaval context of Westeros.

Unfortunately, he chose the wrong boss, who felt very offended when he suggested that option. What Dany wants is absolute power, not shared power or election.

Throughout the course of this story, Tyrion was also the one who has the most experience in ruling (in KL and Meereen). And he did quite effectively. He has visions and reasons. So it would be a waste of his talents if he just dies in the end and no one continues to work on his ideas. 

So that leads to this question, if Tyrion dies, who would help him make his vision of a better world come true? Those should be the people who are close to him enough to appreciate his talents and aspirations. 

Jaime, who always believes in his little brother being the champion of the downtrodden. Jaime himself has potential to become a smart politician and good ruler, he just does not find the interest yet. But maybe with Tyrion’s departure, Jaime would find the passion to realize his brother’s dream of a new world. So, in that way, Jaime becomes the man their father always wanted him to be (a ruler), but just not in the way Tywin expected.

Sansa

Note how Tyrion was captivated by Sansa. 

We’ve seen how Sansa ruled WF effectively. So I expect there will be some chats between Sansa and Tyrion in S8, when they share visions of how to build a better world. That would be one of the factors that sways Tyrion to her side. 

Bran 

Maybe not so many audience notice the metaphorical represetation of this scene between Bran and Tyrion, when Tyrion gave Bran the saddle design enabling the crippled child to ride a horse. It was the gift of knowledge and engineering. It might become much more important than one might think. 

How bittersweet it is for the child whose family and his own life was ruined by Tyrion’s family to receive the gift of knowldege and wisdom from Tyrion, and becomes Brandon the Rebuilder, the broken boy who mends the broken world? That is a much better way for Tyrion to pay the debt his family owed to the Starks and for the Starklings to collect such debt, not through violent revenge, but through give and receive, and helping each other.

Jon 

Who knows? Maybe these two men can become some sort of friendly rivals cum (uneasy) allies in S8? First for Dany’s trust, then for Sansa’s love. Would be both bitter and sweet when your rival is the one who helps you realize your visions of a better world after you pass away.

I hope I have answered your question :)

As Peter Dinklage has said:  “He’s trying to figure out who he really is in this storm of negotiations.” (Peter Dinklage on Tyrion in S8, EW), Tyrion must first identify who he is: the Hand to Queen Daenerys, a Lannister, or a man who serves the realm. Once he figures out who he should be, the choice will be easier. 

Since Jaime would definitely choose to do the right thing (fighting for the living), that would be a decisive factor to sway Tyrion to the Starks’ side, if Dany abandons the fight for the living prematurely. It’s independent of the news about Jon’s parentage. I guess once Jaime arrives in WF, he will have a private chat with Tyrion, in which Tyrion knows that Cersei cheats. So, to protect his siblings,  he will cover such news from Dany, knowing that she is not tolerant and would harshly punish both Cersei and Jaime (and even Tyrion himself) if she knows. He might even secretly make a deal with the Starks in case Dany turns on them. 

However, sooner or later, Dany will realize that the Lannister duo hide the news from her. Coupling with Jon’s parentage (I don’t know how they would reveal the news to the public yet, but it will be absolutely dramatic), Dany will be on fire. My bet is she’s setting WF on fire before she leaves. 

At this point, I think Tyrion would firmly choose his brother over Dany. He will stay with Jaime in WF. Now he knows that Dany will go South to punish Cersei, his next mission is secure an alliance with the Starks for Cersei to save her arse. His role has always been a negotiator.

What does true love mean?

To add more complication to the mix, I believe, at some point, Tyrion will fall in love with Sansa. And his affection for her could be a decisive factor, that moves him for better (or worse?). We will have to wait to see how it turns out. 

About his fate, in my opinion, Tyrion’s fate was sealed the moment he cursed the whole King’s Landing and killed his father. He will see with his own eyes how his curse becomes real, under the hand of his once beloved Queen, the one he helped bring to Westeros. That would be a very very tragic moment for Tyrion. He would not able to forgive himself for wishing such horrible fate for people of this city, and now it is a reality, a reality he helped to forge. In some sense, he has become the monster everyone thinks he is. 

Would Tyrion redeem himself? I think, he would. All his life, Tyrion has been seeking love, acceptance and recognition, from his family and from other people. But he never knows what true love is, except the brotherly love with Jaime. All he’s ever known was politics, money matters and whoring. His relationship with Shae was lust and possession. With Dany, it was a mixture of adoration, fear, the thirst for revenge on Cersei (now he realizes how wrong he was to wish so), and the hope to have his place in building a new world (he will also realize he chooses the wrong person to put this hope on). To make his arc full circle, he will in the end understand what love truly means. Why I believe true love will matter for Tyrion? Because of this converstion from season 2 with Cersei. It was moment after Myrcella’s departure for Dorne (due to a betrothal Tyrion arranged for her) and before the riot in KL (when Sansa was nearly raped and Tyrion was panicked that they lost her.)

One day I pray you love someone. I pray that you love her so much. When you close your eyes, you’ll see her face, you’ll know what it feels, you’ll know what is like to love someone, to truly love someone. Before I take her from you. (Cersei to Tyrion, 2x06)

Interestingly, the camera panned to Sansa after Tyrion left the scene.

Throughout season 2, 3 and the beginning of season 4, they’ve already planted the seed of romance between Tyrion and Sansa (’though one-sided). So what would mean for Tyrion if he realizes that he truly loves someone? Sadly for him, that person might not love him back. What would he do? 

To love is to sacrifce

As Peter Dinklage has said about the Tyrion’s arc, “It ends beautifully for my character whether it be tragic or not.”, so a tragic end is almost guaranteed. But it will be a beautiful end, we will lose lots of tears over the departure of his character. And I think, all of us could be happy for him, if in the last days of his life, Tyrion would understand what it means to truly love someone. Maybe he would never get anything in return, but at least such love brings him a little joy. That’s the sweet part of love. The bitter part? To love someone truly sometimes means that you have to sacrifice yourself so that the one you love would be safe. And I cannot think of anyone else but…

his brother, Jaime…

and this kind-hearted, beautiful princess.

These two people are the sunshine in Tyrion’s world. 

Tyrion’s legacy

Surprisingly, the only person in GoT who might have some glimsp of how to build a better world, up to this point, is Tyrion. He suggested a new way of succession to Dany (to ensure the vision of a new world will sustainably last and would be further built upon generations after generations), not through bloodline, but through election, which can be considered a break-through in the medieaval context of Westeros.

Unfortunately, he chose the wrong boss, who felt very offended when he suggested that option. What Dany wants is absolute power, not shared power or election.

Throughout the course of this story, Tyrion was also the one who has the most experience in ruling (in KL and Meereen). And he did quite effectively. He has visions and reasons. So it would be a waste of his talents if he just dies in the end and no one continues to work on his ideas. 

So that leads to this question, if Tyrion dies, who would help him make his vision of a better world come true? Those should be the people who are close to him enough to appreciate his talents and aspirations. 

Jaime, who always believes in his little brother being the champion of the downtrodden. Jaime himself has potential to become a smart politician and good ruler, he just does not find the interest yet. But maybe with Tyrion’s departure, Jaime would find the passion to realize his brother’s dream of a new world. So, in that way, Jaime becomes the man their father always wanted him to be (a ruler), but just not in the way Tywin expected.

Sansa

Note how Tyrion was captivated by Sansa. 

We’ve seen how Sansa ruled WF effectively. So I expect there will be some chats between Sansa and Tyrion in S8, when they share visions of how to build a better world. That would be one of the factors that sways Tyrion to her side. 

Bran 

Maybe not so many audience notice the metaphorical represetation of this scene between Bran and Tyrion, when Tyrion gave Bran the saddle design enabling the crippled child to ride a horse. It was the gift of knowledge and engineering. It might become much more important than one might think. 

How bittersweet it is for the child whose family and his own life was ruined by Tyrion’s family to receive the gift of knowldege and wisdom from Tyrion, and becomes Brandon the Rebuilder, the broken boy who mends the broken world? That is a much better way for Tyrion to pay the debt his family owed to the Starks and for the Starklings to collect such debt, not through violent revenge, but through give and receive, and helping each other.

Jon 

Who knows? Maybe these two men can become some sort of friendly rivals cum (uneasy) allies in S8? First for Dany’s trust, then for Sansa’s love. Would be both bitter and sweet when your rival is the one who helps you realize your visions of a better world after you pass away.

I hope I have answered your question :)
trail.content:
Hi, thank you very much for your message. In my opinion, Tyrion’s arc will be one of the most interesting arcs in season 8. 

His trilemma

He will find himself struggle between various missions (or priorities): his duty to Dany, Jaime, Cersei (and the child she bears, since I believe he promised her to protect her child), or the realm. At some point, he will have to choose what should be his highest priority. 

As Peter Dinklage has said:  “He’s trying to figure out who he really is in this storm of negotiations.” (Peter Dinklage on Tyrion in S8, EW), Tyrion must first identify who he is: the Hand to Queen Daenerys, a Lannister, or a man who serves the realm. summary: Sorry not sorry, but the Night King easily killed a dragon, and is also unaffected by the fire. So, Dany and her dragons aren't...
body:
Sorry not sorry, but the Night King easily killed a dragon, and is also unaffected by the fire. So, Dany and her dragons aren’t REALLY the answer and and the key to defeat the white walkers.

blog.name: commander-of-death-griffin
blog.title: May We Meet Again
blog.description: Come and let us live, my Dear. Let us love and never fear. Then let amorous kisses dwell, on our lips, begin and tell. A Thousand and a Hundred score, a Hundred and a Thousand more.

summary: I’m a fucking idiot. It just NOW dawned on me after a freaking year long wait that Jamie is heading towards Winterfell. Where...
body: I’m a fucking idiot. It just NOW dawned on me after a freaking year long wait that Jamie is heading towards Winterfell. Where he’ll see Bran again. Since the pilot. Where he didn’t care that he nearly killed a child because he hadn’t evolved yet into the “I now have a conscience” person he is now. I’m super curious how that reunion is gonna go.
